Party.Title: Party
Party.Empty: No one has been added to the party.

SpellManager.DragToPrepare: Drag spells between lists to prepare or unprepare them
SpellManager.SlotsFull: This actor can't prepare any more spells of this level.

Note.Label: Note
Note.Hint: Text displayed with the rolled effect (e.g: "X hit dice turned", "Fire damage"

Range.Label: Range
Range.Note: Leave all fields at zero to ignore range on this action. Set the medium range and leave short or long ranges at zero for ranged actions that don't gain bonuses or penalties from range.

UsesAttempt.Label: Uses an attempt roll
UsesAttempt.Hint: When this action is used, a roll is made. On success, the action is successful.

UsesEffect.Label: Has effects
UsesEffect.Hint: This action has effects that the system is able to model, such as healing, damage, or status effects.

UsesConsumption.Label: Consumes resources
UsesConsumption.Hint: This action uses a resource such as spell slots, item charges, or item quantity.

UsesRestrictions.Label: Is restricted
UsesRestrictions.Hint: This action is restricted by means such as level requirements, having a type of item, etc.

IsBlind.Label: Is rolled blindly
IsBlind.Hint: Players will see that the action was rolled blindly, but will not see the outcome. GMs will always see the outcome of the action.

IsLikeAttack.Label: This is an attack
IsLikeAttack.Hint: This action represents a d20 roll made against a target's armor class.

AttackType.Label: Attack Type
AttackType.Hint: Determines modifiers applied to attack and damage rolls.

AttackBonus.Label: Bonus to attack rolls
AttackBonus.Hint: Add a flat bonus or penalty to the attack roll (e.g., +2 for a magic weapon, -2 for disadvantage)

Operator.Label: Operator
Operator.Hint: How to compare the roll result

Target.Label: Target
Target.Hint: Number to compare against (e.g., 15 for DC 15)

AttemptText.Label: Attempt Text
AttemptText.Hint: Text displayed in the chat card when this action is attempted.

SuccessText.Label: Success Text
SuccessText.Hint: Text displayed in the chat card for a successful use of this action.

FailText.Label: Fail Text
FailText.Hint: Text displayed in the chat card for a failed use of this action.

BlindText.Label: Blind Text
BlindText.Hint: Text displayed in the chat card on rolls where the result should be ambiguous.

HasFlavorText.Label: Has flavor text
HasFlavorText.Hint: This action has custom success, fail, or attempt text.

Attempt.Heading: Attempt Roll
Attempt.Hint: Configure how this action is rolled and what determines success

Type.Heading: Attempt Type
Type.IsLikeAttack: Enable this for weapon attacks and spells that make attack rolls. The system will automatically use attack bonuses and roll against AC.

Attack.Heading: Attack Configuration
Attack.Hint: Configure the type of attack and any bonuses
Attack.TypeHint: Melee: Uses STR modifier. Missile: Uses DEX modifier. None: Just base attack bonus.
Attack.BonusHint: Add a flat bonus or penalty to the attack roll (e.g., +2 for a magic weapon, -2 for disadvantage)

CustomRoll.Heading: Custom Roll Configuration
CustomRoll.Hint: Define a custom roll formula and success condition
CustomRoll.OperatorHint: How to compare the roll result
CustomRoll.TargetHint: Number to compare against (e.g., 15 for DC 15)

AttemptMessages.UsingDefaults: This action uses default attempt messages. Click below to customize success, failure, and attempt text.

IsLikeAttack.Label: This is an attack
IsLikeAttack.Hint: This action represents damage inflicted with a melee or ranged weapon.

Type.Label: Effect Type
Type.Hint: How does this effect interact with targets?

IsMagical.Label: Effect is Magical
IsMagical.Hint: This effect counts as magical for purposes of bypassing mundane damage resistance or spell bonuses to saving throws.

Formula.Label: Dice Formula
Formula.Hint: The dice to be rolled for this effect. For help on dice notation, see Foundry's docs.

Name.Label: Condition Name
Name.Hint: The name of the active effect.

Img.Label: Condition Image
Img.Hint: The image representing the active effect.

Description.Label: Condition Description
Description.Hint: A description of the active effect.

Rounds.Label: Rounds
Rounds.Hint: Number of rounds the effect lasts.

Seconds.Label: Seconds
Seconds.Hint: Number of seconds the effect lasts.

Turns.Label: Turns
Turns.Hint: Number of turns the effect lasts.

Consumption.Heading: Resource Consumption
Consumption.Hint: Configure what resources this action uses when activated

Types.Label: Consumed Resource
Types.Hint: What resource does this action consume when used?

ResourceType.Heading: Resource Type
ResourceType.Hint: What gets consumed when this action is used?

Quantity.Label: Quantity
Quantity.Hint: How much of the resource to consume

ItemConsumption.Heading: Item Consumption
ItemConsumption.Hint: Configure which item and how much to consume (e.g., arrows, potions)
ItemConsumption.ItemHint: Select the item to consume from the actor's inventory
ItemConsumption.QuantityHint: How many to consume per use (usually 1)

ItemCharges.Heading: Item Charges
ItemCharges.Hint: Consume charges/uses from another item (e.g., wand charges, item abilities)
ItemCharges.ItemHint: Select the item to consume charges from
ItemCharges.QuantityHint: How many charges to consume per use

SpellSlot.Heading: Spell Slot
SpellSlot.Hint: Consume a spell slot of a specific level

Class.Label: Class
Class.Hint: The class providing the spell slots

Level.Label: Spell Level
Level.Hint: The level of spell slot to consume

SpellSlot.ClassHint: Which spellcasting class provides the slot

LimitedUses.Heading: Limited Uses
LimitedUses.Hint: This action has a limited number of uses that recharge over time
LimitedUses.MaxHint: Maximum uses before needing to recharge (e.g., 3 for "3/day")
LimitedUses.ValueHint: Current uses remaining (usually starts at max)
LimitedUses.RechargesOnHint: When do all uses restore? (e.g., "Per Day" for daily abilities)

Value.Label: Current Uses
Value.Hint: How many uses of this action remain

Max.Label: Maximum Uses
Max.Hint: Maximum number of uses before needing to recharge

RechargesOn.Label: Recharges On
RechargesOn.Hint: When does this action regain its uses?

Description.Label: Description
Description.Hint: A summary of what this action does.

Level.Heading: Character Level Requirements
Level.Hint: Restrict this action to specific character levels. Leave empty for no restrictions.

Minimum.Label: Minimum Level
Minimum.Hint: The minimum character level required to use this action

Maximum.Label: Maximum Level
Maximum.Hint: The maximum character level that can use this action

DeleteAction.Title: Delete Action
DeleteAction.Content: Are you sure you want to delete the action "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.

DeleteEffect.Title: Delete Effect
DeleteEffect.Content: Are you sure you want to delete the effect "{name}"? This action cannot be undone.

DeleteConditionChange.Title: Delete Condition Change
DeleteConditionChange.Content: Are you sure you want to delete this condition change? This action cannot be undone.

TabDisabled.Attempt: This action does not use an attempt roll. Enable "Uses an attempt roll" in the Settings tab to configure attempt options.
TabDisabled.Effects: This action has no effects. Enable "Has effects" in the Settings tab to add effects.
TabDisabled.Consumption: This action does not consume resources. Enable "Consumes resources" in the Settings tab to configure consumption.
TabDisabled.Restrictions: This action has no restrictions. Enable "Is restricted" in the Settings tab to configure level restrictions.

BasicInfo.Heading: Basic Information
BasicInfo.Hint: The name and icon that identify this action

Capabilities.Heading: Action Capabilities
Capabilities.Hint: Enable the features you need for this action. Each checkbox enables a corresponding tab.
Capabilities.UsesAttempt: Enables Attempt and Attempt Messages tabs. Use for attacks, skill checks, or any roll that can succeed or fail.
Capabilities.UsesEffect: Enables Effects tab. Use for damage, healing, status effects, or any game-mechanical outcome.
Capabilities.UsesConsumption: Enables Consumption tab. Use for actions that consume spell slots, item charges, ammunition, HP, etc.
Capabilities.UsesRestrictions: Enables Restrictions tab. Use for class abilities available only at certain levels.

SpecialProperties.Heading: Special Properties
SpecialProperties.IsBlind: Players see that a roll was made but not the result. GM always sees the outcome. Useful for secret checks.

Range.Heading: Range
Range.Hint: Define range bands for this action. Leave all at 0 to ignore range. Only set medium range for simple ranged attacks without bonuses/penalties.

Restrictions.Heading: Action Restrictions
Restrictions.Hint: Limit when this action is available

LevelRestrictions.Heading: Level Restrictions
LevelRestrictions.Hint: Restrict this action to specific character levels. Useful for class abilities that are replaced at higher levels or only available in a level range.
LevelRestrictions.MinHint: Minimum character level required (leave empty for no minimum)
LevelRestrictions.MaxHint: Maximum character level allowed (leave empty for no maximum)
LevelRestrictions.Example: Example: A 1st-level class ability that's replaced at 5th level would have Min: 1, Max: 4

BaseItemId.Label: Base Item ID
BaseItemId.Hint: Identifies the base item template for stacking purposes. Items with the same Base Item ID can potentially be stacked together.

IsStackable.Label: Can Stack
IsStackable.Hint: Whether this item can be stacked with other identical items. Uncheck to make this item unique.

Quantity.Label: Quantity
Quantity.Hint: The number of this item in the stack

Cost.Label: Cost
Cost.Hint: The base cost of this item in gold pieces

Value.Label: Remaining Uses
Value.Hint: The number of uses remaining for this item

Max.Label: Maximum Uses
Max.Hint: The maximum number of uses this item can have

Weight.Label: Weight
Weight.Hint: The weight of a single unit of this item in coins

Description.Label: Description
Description.Hint: A detailed description of the item's appearance and function

FlavorText.Label: Flavor Text
FlavorText.Hint: Additional narrative or atmospheric text about the item

Banner.Label: Banner Image
Banner.Hint: An image to represent this item

IsContainer.Label: Is Container
IsContainer.Hint: Whether this item can hold other items

WeightMax.Label: Maximum Weight
WeightMax.Hint: The maximum weight this container can hold

WeightModifier.Label: Weight Modifier
WeightModifier.Hint: Multiplier applied to contents' weight (e.g., 0.5 for magical bags)

IsIdentified.Label: Identified
IsIdentified.Hint: Whether this item's true nature is known to players

Name.Label: Unidentified Name
Name.Hint: What this item is called before identification

FlavorText.Label: Unidentified Flavor Text
FlavorText.Hint: Flavor text shown before the item is identified

Description.Label: Unidentified Description
Description.Hint: Description shown before the item is identified

XPReward.Label: Identification XP
XPReward.Hint: Experience points awarded when this item is identified

CountsAsTreasure.Label: Counts as Treasure
CountsAsTreasure.Hint: Whether this item should be counted towards treasure value for XP

WeaponBonus.Label: Weapon Bonus
WeaponBonus.Hint: A modifier applied to attack and damage rolls.

IsSlow.Label: Slow Weapon
IsSlow.Hint: This weapon's wielder will go last in combat in some initiative schemes.

ArmorClass.Label: Armor Class
ArmorClass.Hint: How difficult it is for an attacker to hit a target in this armor. Note: if "Should Treat As Bonus" is enabled, consider this field to be a modifier.

ArmorClassOffset.Label: Armor Class Offset
ArmorClassOffset.Hint: How far from the chosen combat scheme's base armor class this system falls.

ArmorBonus.Label: Armor Bonus
ArmorBonus.Hint: A modifier to the armor class of this armor, compared to similar suits.

ShouldTreatAsBonus.Label: Treat as Bonus
ShouldTreatAsBonus.Hint: This piece of armor modifies, rather than sets, a user's base armor class. A common example of this is a shield.

IsHeavy.Label: Heavy Armor
IsHeavy.Hint: This armor's wearer will have their speed reduced in some encumbrance schemes.

Equipment.Title: Equipment
Equipment.NoWeaponActions: None of your weapons have actions.

XP.Label: Experience Value
XP.Hint: The amount of XP awarded when this monster is defeated

UsesHitDice.Label: Uses Hit Dice
UsesHitDice.Hint: Whether this monster's HP is calculated from hit dice or set manually

Count.Label: Hit Dice Count
Count.Hint: The number of hit dice this monster has

Size.Label: Hit Die Size
Size.Hint: The size of die used for this monster's hit dice (d4, d6, d8, etc.)

Modifier.Label: Hit Dice Modifier
Modifier.Hint: A modifier added to the monster's hit dice total

Encumbrance.Label: Encumbrance Modifier
Encumbrance.Hint: Modifier to the monster's maximum encumbrance capacity

Speed.Label: Speed Modifier
Speed.Hint: Modifier to the monster's base movement speed

Tactics.Label: Tactics
Tactics.Hint: How this monster typically behaves in combat

Lair.Label: Lair
Lair.Hint: Description of where this monster typically lives

Intelligence.Label: Intelligence
Intelligence.Hint: The monster's cognitive capabilities (e.g., Animal, Low, Average, High, Genius)

Value.Label: Morale Rating
Value.Hint: How likely the monster is to remain in combat (2-12 scale, higher is braver)

IsWorthPanickingOverDying.Label: Causes morale checks on death
IsWorthPanickingOverDying.Hint: Whether this monster's allies should make morale checks when it is killed

Speed.Label: Movement Speed
Speed.Hint: How far the character can move in a turn, measured in feet

AttackRollOffset.Label: Attack Roll Bonus
AttackRollOffset.Hint: Bonus applied to all attack rolls (represents THAC0 in descending AC systems)

ArmorClassOffset.Label: Armor Class Modifier
ArmorClassOffset.Hint: Modifier to the character's base armor class

Attack.Label: Melee Attack Bonus
Attack.Hint: Bonus applied to melee attack rolls

Damage.Label: Melee Damage Bonus
Damage.Hint: Bonus applied to melee damage rolls

Attack.Label: Missile Attack Bonus
Attack.Hint: Bonus applied to ranged attack rolls

Damage.Label: Missile Damage Bonus
Damage.Hint: Bonus applied to ranged damage rolls

Loyalty.Label: Loyalty Rating
Loyalty.Hint: Determines how loyal retainers and hirelings are to their employer

IsRetainer.Label: Is Retainer
IsRetainer.Hint: Whether this character is a hireling or retainer of another character

Currency.Label: Wage Currency
Currency.Hint: The type of currency used to pay this retainer

Quantity.Label: Wage Amount
Quantity.Hint: How much the retainer is paid per interval

Interval.Label: Payment Interval
Interval.Hint: How often the retainer must be paid (e.g., daily, weekly, monthly)

Max.Label: Maximum HP
Max.Hint: The character's maximum hit points when fully healed

Temporary.Label: Temporary HP
Temporary.Hint: Additional hit points that are lost before regular hit points

Alignment.Label: Alignment
Alignment.Hint: The character's moral and ethical alignment

IdentityPrefix.Label: Title Prefix
IdentityPrefix.Hint: A title that appears before the character's name (e.g., Sir, Lady, Dr.)

IdentitySuffix.Label: Title Suffix
IdentitySuffix.Hint: A title or descriptor that appears after the character's name

Description.Label: Physical Description
Description.Hint: A description of the character's physical appearance

Background.Label: Background
Background.Hint: The character's history and background story

Banner.Label: Banner Image
Banner.Hint: A decorative image displayed on the character sheet

Errors.OneClassOnly: A character may only have one class.

XPTable.NoMoreConMod: Modifiers from CON no longer apply

Category.Label: Category
Category.Empty: No resource categories have been created.

Pool.Label: Resource
Pool.Empty: No resources exist for this category.

gearTable.hint: The Roll Table to roll on when determining starting equipment for this class.
gearTable.label: Gear Table

isAncestryClass.hint: This class represents an ancestry, rather than a class
isAncestryClass.label: Ancestry Class

Information.PrerequisitesHint: Set minimum ability scores required for this identity. Leave at 0 for no requirement.

RollConfig.Title: Roll Dice
RollConfig.ReversedSuccessHint: This roll is successful when the result is higher than the target.

StackItems.Title: Stack Items?
StackItems.Message: Stack {itemName} (×{droppedQty}) with existing {itemName} (×{existingQty}) for a total of ×{totalQty}?

SplitStack.Title: Split {itemName}
SplitStack.Message: How many {itemName} would you like to split off? (Total: {quantity})

AbilityScores.Name: Ability Scores
AbilityScores.Hint: While most systems use the six core stats, modifiers from stats may vary between systems.

SavingThrows.Name: Saving Throws
SavingThrows.Hint: The set of saving throws and save resolution style to use

Combat.Name: Combat Rules
Combat.Hint: Changes between combat rules include the base AC and whether or not the system uses ascending/descending AC

Initiative.Name: Initiative Rules
Initiative.Hint: Typical modifications to initiative include dice rolls, surprise, and whether the game uses group or individual initiative.

TagManager.Empty: No custom tags have been defined.

Sources.Name: Data Sources for Character Creation
Sources.Hint: The folders and compendiums that the Character Wizard pulls classes and equipment from.
Sources.Title: Character Creation: Data Sources

str.Label: Strength
str.Hint: Hit harder and more accurately with melee weapons; open stuck doors.

wis.Label: Wisdom
wis.Hint: More easily resist the effects of spells.

dex.Label: Dexterity
dex.Hint: Hit harder, and more accurately, with missle weapons; become harder to hit.

cha.Label: Charisma
cha.Hint: Garner better reactions from hirelings and monsters; inspire loyalty.

death.Hint: Resist poison, venom, and death magic.

paralysis.Hint: Resist attempts to crush you, hold you in place, or turn you to stone.

breath.Hint: Avoid fireballs, duck out of the way of dragon's breath.

OpenDoors.Label: Open Stuck Doors
OpenDoors.SuccessText: ... and the door is forced open!
OpenDoors.AttemptText: {name} attempts to force open the stuck door...
OpenDoors.BlindText: ... but did they manage to open it?

ListenAtDoors.Label: Listen At Doors
ListenAtDoors.SuccessText: ... and if there's something to hear, {name} heard it!

FindSecretDoors.Label: Find Secret Doors
FindSecretDoors.SuccessText: ... and if there's something to find, {name} found it!

FindTraps.Label: Find Room Traps
FindTraps.SuccessText: ... and if there's something to find, {name} found it!

COMBAT.UseGroupInitiativeHint: Should the tracker group combatants? Note: groups are, by default, grouped by disposition, but an individual combatant's group can be changed.
COMBAT.RerollBehaviorHint: Should the tracker reroll initiative, keep rolled initiative between rounds, or reset initiative to an unrolled state?
